aoop.asteroids.model

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • aoop.asteroids.model.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Asteroid, Bullet, Spaceship

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    GameObject is the abstract superclass for all game objects. I.e. bullets, asteroids and spaceships. This class provides some of the basic mechanics, such as collision detection, and the desctruction mechanism.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean destroyed
      Holds true if object collided with another object, false otherwise.

      Location on the X axis.

      Location on the Y axis.
      protected int radius
      Radius of the object.
      protected int stepsTilCollide
      Counts the amount of game ticks left, until this object is allowed to collide.
      protected double velocityX
      Velocity in X direction.
      protected double velocityY
      Velocity in Y direction.

      • getLocation

        public java.awt.Point getLocation()
        This method combines both location fields in a java.awt.Point object by casting them to integers. The point object is returned.
        Returns:
        the location of the object.

      • collides

        public boolean collides(GameObject other)
        Given some other game object, this method checks whether the current object and the given object collide with each other. It does this by measuring the distance between the objects and checking whether it is larger than the sum of the radii. Furthermore both objects should be allowed to collide.
        Parameters:
        other - the other object that it may collide with.
        Returns:
        true if object collides with given object, false otherwise.

      • stepsTilCollide

        public int stepsTilCollide()
        Returns the amount of game ticks it takes until this object is allowed to collide.
        Returns:
        the amount of game ticks it takes until this object is allowed to collide.
